result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court will proceed with plea questionnaire.

11:12 Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sticht files Information charging 1 count felony bail jumping, plead guilty, court costs. Atty Weber has waiver of preliminary hearing and plea questionnaire. Atty Weber, sexual assault charges would like dismissed with prejudice, State agrees.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY. Court notes change in Information, offense occured in Aitkin County MN. Atty Weber stipulates to factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty. Sticht addresses the court. Atty Weber addresses the court. Defendant addresses the court. Court orders $515.00 court costs DNA Sample and Surcharge, 1 year to pay, pay $50 month. Court dismisses original charges of sexual assault dismissed with prejudice. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 11:30
Plea hearing on October 30, 2017 at 11:15 am.

9:20 a.m.  Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared via phone.   Sticht - reached a resolution, set for plea and sentencing.  Weber - in agreement.  See JA for scheduling.  9:23 a.m.
Status conference on September 25, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on July 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

4:09 p.m.  Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.    VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ.  Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in custody.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Weber addresses the court regarding Mr. LaFlamme's non appearance.  Weber requesting signature bond be reinstated.  Thorie - not familiar with terms of original bond.  Thorie - requests no contact provision be added to bond. Court reinstates $10,000 signature bond with added conditions of no contact with H.L.M.  Set for continuation of motion hearing.  Off record at 4:16 p.m.  for scheduling.  Weber requesting defendant appear by phone for status conference with Judge Boles.  Thorie has no objection, but appearance by phone is mandatory.  Address:  14 Hesper St, McGregor, MN  55760.  Phone 218-537-0951, his father's number.  Will call with his number when he gets released.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

11:19  Attorney Julie A. Weber in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody in MN and does not appear.  State requests a bench warrant. Court authorizes bench warrant. Will not be presented until next Monday

10:41  Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Wilson who appears by telephone is sw and ex by Julie Weber  Atty OSullivan x-exams. Julie Weber re-directs. Julie Weber offers Affidavit of Bob Schofield Exh # 1  Offered and received. OSuulivan refers to the Juvenile Justice Code from 2003 for judicial notice Sec 938. Arguements are given. Court states they have provided what he needs to decide.  Attys to set date 60 days out for decision.   Calendar call this date.
from Judge Boles to Atty Weber's request for telephone testimony "APPROVED"
from Atty Weber RE: asking the court to approve witnesses appearance via phone. No objection from Atty O'Sullivan.
Motion hearing on October 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

2:35 Defendant Brian LaFlamme in court, in custody with Attorney Julie A. Weber.  Rory O'Sullivan appears for the State of Wisconsin. O'Sullivan calls witness to the stand, Officer Gottfredsen.  Witness is sworn in.  O'Sullivan examines the witness. Witness gives testimony. Atty Weber objects to identification, officer not involved in the investigation.  Objection overruled. Witness ID's the defendant in the court room. Atty Weber has no questions. Atty Weber addresses warrants issued in case, defendant in custody in MN requests signature bond reinstated, defendant will be released Aug. 11.  O'Sullivan does not object.  Court orders $10,000 signature bond reinstated. Court: schedule for 60 days out so that Atty Weber can get into contact with Mr. Wilson. 02:52

02:16 Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is also set for motion hearing.  Ms. Weber filed motion to dimiss Attorney O'Sullivan addresses this, O'Sullivan feels that motion should be denied.  Atty Weber addresses motion and states that files have been destroyed due to delay in bringing forth charges, defendant a juvenile and time of offense. Atty Weber addresses issue of statute of limitiations and issues of jurisdiction.  Atty Weber has had difficulties contacting Inv. Wilson, retired.  O'sullivan states that someone else can testify from RF PD on Inv. Wilson's behalf. Court will proceed with Preliminary Hearing will not decide today, court gives Atty Weber 60 days will set a hearing. Atty Weber objects to testimony for preliminary hearing, court should review preliminary hearing procedure for cases in 2003.  Atty O'Sullivan disagrees.  Court will use procedure from 2014 for preliminary hearing.

Minnesota Department of Corrections Agreement on Detainers Form I- Notice of Untried Indictment, Information or Complaint and of Right to Request Disposition, Form II- Offender's Notice of Placement of Imprisonment and Request for Disposition of Indictments, Information or Complaints, Form III- Certificate of Offender Status, Form IV-Offer to Deliver Temporary Custody, Form VI-Evidence of Agents' Authority to Act for Receiving State, and Form VII-Prosecutor's Acceptance of Temporary Custoday Offered in Connection with a Prisoner's Request for Disposition of Detainer.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 1:20  Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in court with attorney Julie Ann Weber.  Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Weber states that the defense will waive the preliminary hearing time limits. The Judge exams the defendant regarding his right to a preliminay hearing within 20 days. Court accepts the waiver of the of time limits for a preliminary hearing. The court will set up a briefing schedule   45 days for Pros.to file brief  30 days for defense to respond. 10 days for Pros to respond Set hearing mid to late Feb  Court advises the defendant of the bond conditions.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

BOND CONDITIONS READ TO THE DEF BY THE COURT COMMISSIONER 
ADDRESS:  same as complaint 
DOB:  08-15-1987
PHONE:  218-546-3356  cell phone

3:05 pm  
Defendant Bryan A. LaFlamme in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Lars Loberg.  Def is in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan by phone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Charges read to the def.  Further reading waived.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  State asks for cash bond, but will accept an explanation for his nonappearance and request $10,000 signature bond.  Loberg responds.  Def responds to the court re: his nonappearance.   PH is set for Dec 1, 2014 at 1:00 pm.  Def states he has warrants in other counties.  State recommends waiving time limits for PH and that he should contact Julie Weber.   Court explains waiving PH time limits.   NOT A VETERAN.
Julie Weber
Amended to correct middle initial to "A"
